body: I plan to close out this PR in a stale PR sweep soon.
I plan to close out this PR in a stale PR sweep soon.

@KayLerch do you think you'll have time to come back to this?  I'm inclined to close this as part of a stale PR sweep but wanted to check with you.  Totally understand if so.  And if you can't do it soon then perhaps you can close it and try again later?
Will review...
@pvillard31 do you still think we can get this across the finish line?

I think we should close out this PR until licensing challenges are resolved and momentum is restored.  It is certainly cool so even if we end up with a process that puts an abnormal burden on the user for administration of it there may still be good use for it.  But for now I'd advocate closing this.
@simonellistonball can you consider closing this in favor of the approach outlined in NIFI-1922 which takes advantage of a new runtime classpath manipulation option which has been proven to work.
@atilcock i believe this PR can be closed in favor of the proven approach outlined in NIFI-1922.  If you agree please close this. thanks!
@apsaltis can you please close this out as Mark references that it is merged.  Thanks
@apsaltis @ijokarumawak is this PR obe?  I'd like to close out or push over the finish line stale PRs so please advise.  Thanks
@markap14 I think we should close this.  It is already fixed on the 1.x line.  Doing a stale PR sweep and this comes up.  Would like to close it out or push it across the finish line.
Unfortunately this isn't going to work due to license issues so closing.
I'm in favor of closing it, sound good @markap14?
Sounds good to me. Done.

@vcharmcaster Since it appears this is your initial participation with Apache NiFi I'd like to welcome you and thank you for your contribution and participation. 
Aside from making things run smoothly (as @joewitt pointed out), the core reason for having JIRA corresponding to every PR is the traceability factor where users and developers like  you can clearly see what issues are being addressed. So please file a JIRA - https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NIFI and update your PR and commit message. And don't hesitate to ask for help with this process if need to.
@jfrazee i'd like to help you get this pushed across the finish line.  Can you please rebase?
@jdye64 will you have time to address @jvwing findings?  Would like to get this across the line.  We're trying to get the list of stale PRs burned down.
@kirkalicious do you think you'll be able to come back to this one?  I'd like to get PRs which have stalled cleaned out or pushed across the line.  Thanks

@jvwing wow sorry its been a long time for my response. I've tried to go through and make all of the cleanup suggestions you have made.

Yes, the intention is a single output per sheet in the excel file. Keep in mind that if the sheet is not .xlsx and rather .xls format you would see the behavior you are experiencing. Can you attach the excel doc you were testing with?

I made the change to case of the attribute

Also adjusted the error handling to prevent the end user from being pummeled with a full stack trace.
Closing for now, rework is needed.

@brianburnett looks like there has been good review/edit cycles here.  Can you rebase and push and advise when ready for a last look.  I can imagine a lot of folks will be pleased to have this.
@scottyaslan @mcgilman is this still relevant/open?
@combineads @markap14 can we get this pushed across the finish line?
@miquillo will you have a chance to address james feedback?  I'd like to get PRs which have stalled closed out or completed.  Thanks

@mcgilman @joewitt it appears as though this approach does something to adjust the zoom behavior but is not solving the root of the problem. I am closing this PR and cancelling the patch. We will need to revisit the issue...
@ijokarumawak @ToivoAdams @trixpan can we reach consensus on next steps here and go for it?
@joaohf @pvillard31 can you two work together to close this one out?  Looks very close to being ready.
@pvillard31 looks like this will need to be rebased.  Given the flow versioning/registry work this might be considered as a not necessary step.  Do you agree?
Yes @joewitt , I definitely agree. Closing.
@olegz can you review/respond to Mark's feedback?

It sounds like this PR/discussion has resulted in identifying the need to restart.  I recommend closing this PR as-is and using the appropriate JIRA(s) to further the discussion.  Leaving active PRs outstanding can complicate PR review cycles.  Thanks!

@HandOfGod94 

1. `EncryptContent` should encrypt flowfile content. It should not operate on attributes. At most, it could *add* an attribute documenting what encryption algorithm, KDF, etc. were used to encrypt the content. 
1. You do not need a new ticket, you can create a new PR against NIFI-2961. If you undertake a task solely to modify `EncryptContent` for some reason, that would be a new Jira. 
1. The shared logic should absolutely be refactored out of `EncryptContent`. Again, do not try to add the responsibility for encrypting attributes to `EncryptContent`.

@joewitt Yes, thanks for getting us moving, I'll continue reviewing.

@jdye64 Thanks for the updates, I'll take another look shortly.

@pvillard31 I could envision someone configuring the flow really wanting/needing to control whether these new attributes you've created are placed onto the flow file.  if the command contained sensitive information or details they'd not want made available downstream for example.  That said this could be removed with an UpdateAttribute and perhaps we can save this for a later PR/JIRA if necessary.  Will continue the review.

I was testing this PR using Amazon Linux.
Checking if I can refer ${NIFI_HOME} environmental value via Attribute Expression Language, before and after applying the patch. I set run.as = 'nifi', and execute `bin/nifi.sh start` by root user.

```properties
# conf/bootstrap.conf
run.as=nifi
```

NiFi flow is simple as: `GenerateFlowFile` using dynamic attribute as `nifi.home` = `${NIFI_HOME}`, also I added `lang` = `${LANG}` to make sure that it can refer OS env values via VariableRegistry.

## Result: Without this PR

```properties
nifi.home=(Empty string)
lang=en_US.UTF-8
```

NIFI_HOME was not retrieved as expected.

## Result: With this PR

```properties
nifi.home=/mnt
lang=en_US.UTF-8
```

Although NIFI_HOME was retrieved, the value was not the expected one. It should be `/mnt/nifi-1.2.0-SNAPSHOT` but it was just `/mnt`.

I also found that without `run.as` property, nifi.sh doesn't work with this PR. It seems Command argument is not passed properly to RunNiFi:

```bash
[root@ip-172-31-20-144 nifi-1.2.0-SNAPSHOT-root]# ./bin/nifi.sh status
Java home: /usr/lib/jvm/jre
NiFi home: /mnt/nifi-1.2.0-SNAPSHOT-root
Bootstrap Config File: /mnt/nifi-1.2.0-SNAPSHOT-root/conf/bootstrap.conf
Usage:
java org.apache.nifi.bootstrap.RunNiFi [<-verbose>] <command> [options]
Valid commands include: ...
```

I will keep investigating what's going on but would like to share current status. Please let me know if you noticed something.

Thanks!
Was this performed by the PR on its own or applied on top of current master?  I see there is a conflict currently.  Can evaluate tomorrow.
@pvillard31 please close this manually.  Has been merged to master and the JIRA closed.  Thanks!

Reviewing...

(fixing typos and adding tests).

I just noticed in the added unit test that one of the examples of a "query" that returns no ResultSets is an "UPDATE". Are you proposing that ExecuteSQL be able to handle these kinds of statements? In my experience, PutSQL is used for these kinds of statements. Do you see ExecuteSQL needing to be able to handle these as well? If so, can you describe a use case?
+1 merged to master

@mattyb149 I generally use ExecuteSQL to call Stored Procedures. Unfortunately Stored Procedures are such a pain in Derby it was easier to build a test that called an update statement.

However, I have already used ExecuteSQL for Inserts in the past without issue and without modification. I didn't really even think about using PutSQL since it was a single record I was inserting for tracking metrics in an external reporting database.
+1 merged to master
@markap14 please see comments i left on the JIRA.

the version of a given dependency and its licensing we use is set at a specific time.  I'm not sure.  Not a lawyer.  But I'd prefer we focus only on our nifi copyright aspects and maintain our handling of libraries as-is.  Is it a pain to update the mechanism you used to make the changes to avoid changing more than just the nifi part?
Thanks @apiri , I didn't notice that nifi.sh has conflict. I used latest 1.2.0-SNAPSHOT and replaced nifi.sh with the one in this PR. I'll test it again once the conflict gets addressed.

All tests pass, contrib-check passes, +1 and merging.
@pvillard31 Pierre, I apologize, during the rebase & merge, my *author* overwrote yours on the commit. The work was excellent, I just added some repeatable tests. Thanks.
@pvillard31 Thanks for updating the PR, LGTM. Squashed and merged it into master branch.
@olegz Thanks for updating the PR. Please check the comment I put on the provenance once again.

Hey @alopresto, no worries. Thanks a lot for the review and the unit tests (I was not sure how to tackle it in Groovy but looking at your code is instructive!). Out of curiosity, do you think that the feature should be added in standalone mode? When coding this PR, I felt that a user would not really need this feature without the use of a CA, but I may be missing a use case here, and this could be addressed in another JIRA.
Hey @joewitt, I will update the PR asap this week.

Standalone mode still interacts with a CA (something has to sign the issued node certificates), it's just that the CA runs ephemerally on the same system as the command-line invocation as opposed to on another instance in the client/server model. 

I agree that a new Jira is sufficient to capture this feature because it is more *likely* someone deploying lots of nodes behind a load balancer would be using the client/server model.
OK, thanks! Will raise a JIRA and have a look. Should be straightforward.

@pvillard31 I have no issues with the idea you're proposing here. I would suggest, though, that we should use properties like <nifi.jvm.heap.init>512m</nifi.jvm.heap.init> instead of <nifi.jvm.heap.mb.init>512</nifi.jvm.heap.mb.init>. There's no need to enforce that the units be in MB. Most often, if someone wants to change it, they'll actually want to change to GB.
@markap14, I agree. One question though: I was going to update ``nifi.jvm.permgen.mb`` as well but I didn't find any occurrence of this property. Should it be removed or did I miss it?

@jdye64 any chance you could have some cycles to review this as the originator of the JIRA?

How database specific is this? I hadn't heard of it before, in looking around online it looks like it's for MySQL/MariaDB?

It sounds like a great idea for the systems that can support it, I'm just wondering where it belongs. Is this something that should be in the DatabaseAdapter layer?

This is really cool and I suspect these processors will get a lot of use.  Some feedback below.

TransformCSVtoJSON: 
1) It needs to set the content type attribute.  Aids content viewing and routing decisions.  For example
          flowFile = session.putAttribute(flowFile, CoreAttributes.MIME_TYPE.key(), "application/json");

UpdateAttributeWithSchema: 
1) Recommend changing the name to 'ExtractSchema'.  The name is confusing when you consider 'UpdateAttribute' processor and what that one does (and is very common).
2) It grabs the schema definition from the registry service and makes that a flow file attribute.  This is problematic if the schema is large.  We do not want large flow file attributes.  So this needs to be limited.  Why is this processor needed?

TransformJSONToAvro:
1) Needs to set the content type attribute.  According to the latest avro spec it is "avro/binary"

TransformAvroToCSV
1) Needs to set the content type attribute.  "text/csv"

TransformCSVToAvro
1) Needs to set the content type attribute.

TransformAvroToJson
1) Needs to set the content type attribute.

TransformJSONToCSV
1) Needs to set the content type attribute.
Also the nifi-registry-nar LICENSE and NOTICE file needs a lot of work.  This thing has a lot of dependencies.  Take a look at the hadoop nar LICENSE/NOTICE to get started.
